comments.author: YOBOY BANGSLOL

comments.text:
Whoa its amazing just how many people are commenting about seeing the world 
"one day". Well I have been to and fro my friends and the thing that shocks 
me about every place I meet is that they all have a projected expiration 
date. I have visited every continent on earth and something along the lines 
of 30+ countries and any place worth visiting is about to go through some 
radical change to the environment or social structure and eventually become 
a dreary clone of American cities like much of
comments.author: YOBOY BANGSLOL

comments.author: Isabella Barber

comments.text:
Everyday I see how my day goes and I have always wondered how *that same 
day* goes for other people around earth (My World). Thankfully, I won’t 
wonder anymore. The movie is here. Tomorrow, I plan to seat down, relax, 
get some popcorn, and just enjoy *Life in a Day* … It is finally here (for 
free). JAR

p.s. click link on comments below and that will take you to the movie/film. 
It also has captions/subtitles for a lot of different languages look for 
yours in the “CC” button of the video. JAR﻿
comments.author: Jovanny A Rodriguez

comments.text:
Cada día yo veo como mi día va y también siempre me eh preguntado como ira *ese 
mismo día* para otros seres humanos alrededor del mundo. Gracias a la Vida, 
no tendré que preguntarme más. La película esta aquí (y gratis). Mañana 
planeo sentarme, relajarme, con palomitas de maíz, y a disfrutar la 
película “Life in a Day” (Un Día en La Vida). JAR

nota: cliquear el link de arriba y eso te llevara a la película. La 
película tiene subtítulos en Español. Cliquear donde dice “CC” en el video 
y busque por “Español” (Spanish). JAR
comments.author: Jovanny A Rodriguez

comments.author: courtneydice

comments.text:
@Astrocatlady life isn't all rainbows and butterflies. That's what they 
were trying to show with the cow. This is REAL life in a day, not an 
airbrushed Hollywood writer's version. Pain and suffering happens every 
single day.
comments.author: BubbleGumee1

comments.text:
@NJbug3 I'd say there WAS suffering....how about that poor cow that had to 
be shot TWICE??!! I loved the film, but why that was put in, I have no 
idea. I cannot imagine a child's reaction to that, as it sickened me. Of 
all the beauty, THAT image sticks in my mind. Too bad, as it's a stunning 
film & I loved the rest of it! I still feel sick. Just awful!
comments.author: Astrocatlady
